alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 7:52AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 AM MST, Gauge reports indicated ongoing runoff in local waterways within a rugged portion of northeast Maricopa County including Sycamore Creek. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Seven Springs Wash, Sycamore Creek, Lime Creek, Sheep Creek, Mesquite Wash, Camp Creek, Blue Wash, Copper Camp Creek, and Ironwood Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort McDowell, Rio Verde, Round Valley, Sunflower, Seven Springs, and Four Peaks Off Highway Vehicle Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
